content.description: <math alttext="2 A g solid plus C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous react to produce 2 A g with a positive one charge aqueous plus C u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ag(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Cu(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Half-Reaction Standard Reduction Potential, <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> (<math alttext="In volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge aqueous plus one electron produce A g solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="positive 0.80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous plus 2 electrons produce C u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="positive 0.34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> The reaction represented by the equation above serves as the basis for the construction of an electrochemical cell. The table gives the reduction half-reactions and their respective standard reduction potentials. Based on the overall reaction, which of the following identifies the type of electrochemical cell that was constructed based on the value of <math alttext="delta G" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>G</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>?

choices.label: A galvanic or voltaic cell, because <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <mi>G</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>96</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>500</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.46</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>000</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>44</mn> <msub> <mrow> <mtext> kJ/mol</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </semantics> </math> and its operation generates a potential of <math alttext="0.46 volt" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>0.46</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>V</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

A galvanic or voltaic cell, because <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <mi>G</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mn>96</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>500</mn> <mo>×</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.46</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>000</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>89</mn> <msub> <mrow> <mtext> kJ/mol</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </semantics> </math> and its operation generates a potential of <math alttext="0.46 volt" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>0.46</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>V</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

An electrolytic cell, because <math alttext="delta G equals the negative of the fraction 96500 times negative 0.46 over 1000, which equals 44 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>96</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.46</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mtext>1,000</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>44</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and its operation requires a potential smaller than <math alttext="0.46 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.46</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be supplied.

An electrolytic cell, because <math alttext="delta G equals the negative of the fraction 2 times 96500 times negative 0.46 over 1000, which equals 89 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mn>96</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.46</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mtext>1,000</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>89</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and its operation requires a potential greater than <math alttext="0.46 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.46</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be supplied.

content.answer: An electrolytic cell, because <math alttext="delta G equals the negative of the fraction 2 times 96500 times negative 0.46 over 1000, which equals 89 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mn>96</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>×</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>(</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.46</mn><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mtext>1,000</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>89</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and its operation requires a potential greater than <math alttext="0.46 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.46</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be supplied.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
